intro: Quercus brandisiana, commonly known as the Brandis oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Myanmar, and Thailand. This deciduous tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a broad, spreading crown and thick, leathery leaves. The acorns produced by this species are an important food source for various wildlife, including birds and mammals. Its adaptability to different soil types and climate conditions makes it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
